Posts.Content: I stopped my tamoxefen after one year. Suffered constant pain which I could live with but the vertigo I couldn't. My teeth got chipped and dislocated my shoulder as I was falling all the time. My oncologist insisted it wasn't the tamoxefen but every time I stopped vertigo stopped. It was a near fatal experience from a combination of tamoxefen, anti depressants to help flushes and extreme moods and anti inflammatory tabs for shoulder that made me think I have had enough.  I wouldn't advise anyone to stop unless they had good reason.
Posts.Title: RE: Did anyone go off Arimidex early and have long term success?

Posts.Content: I had four AC chemo and needed 12 taxol after, the easy one I was told. After two something didn't feel right. Got peripheral neuropathy in both feet and could barely walk. Some say its like walking on glass, mine felt I was wearing shoes three sizes too small. Very hard to walk. On third one started to get spasms and couldn't talk.  On my next due date a woman who had started a week before me arrived in  a wheelchair. I got up and left and never went back. It does happen. It went completely in one foot, but in winter the other hurts if it gets a little cold. It like having block of ice stuck to it.  But I can live with this and am able to walk properly again. Hope she feels better soon.
Posts.Title: Neuropathy from chemo
